FuncDef: The mkdir command creates a subdirectory in a specified directory of a storage device. The mkdir command creates a subdirectory in a specified directory of a storage device.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the directory name.
The value is a character string in the format of [ drive ][ path ]. An absolute path name is a string of 1 to 255 characters. A relative path name is a string of 1 to 128 characters. Up to 8 levels of directories are supported.
An absolute path is in the format of drive[ path ], and a relative path is in the format of path. That is, a relative path is the root path of the current working path.

ExtraInfo:
You can run the mkdir command to create a subdirectory.
The created subdirectory cannot have the same name as any other subdirectory or file in the specified directory.
